name: Documents & Objects 0001-0100

items.description: Painting (oil?) by Diana Aikens
Painting (oil?) by Diana Aikens
"Mustache" cup, hand-painted by Diana Aikens (1 of 3 images)
"Mustache" cup, hand-painted by Diana Aikens (1 of 3 images)
"Mustache" cup, hand-painted by Diana Aikens (1 of 3 images)

Mason and Hamlin organ brought from Vermont when George and Diana moved west. Located in front hallway of Otis and Mabel's home on Ellis Street in Bellingham. Now in Gamwell House owned by Ken and Marcia Culver. Solid black walnut, still playable.
Watercolor of the Alderbrook Farmhouse by Bill Trogdon. View from road to Pt. Lawrence Lodge.
Oil painting by Diana Aikens. Appears in photograph 0412 in parlor of Alderbrook farmhouse. Now in Gamwell Home.
Letter from Mary to Ken and Marcia Culver regarding book and signed photograph given to O.H. Culver when he interviewed Mark Twain during Twain's visit to Fairhaven, WA in 1895.
Front of signed photograph given to O.H. Culver by Mark Twain
Back of signed photograph given to O.H. Culver by Mark Twain
Note on first page of Mark Twain book regarding O.H. Culver's interview.
Newspaper clipping describing Mark Twain's visit to Fairhaven, WA in 1895 and his interactions with Roland Gamwell.
Retyping of Carroll Culver's brief description of his early life.
Carroll Culver's drawing of the O.H. Culver family home in Friday Harbor where he was born in 1904.
items.notes: There is a tape recording of Carroll describing this home

items.description: Carroll Culver lament and ode to Jean Culver done on Smith Corona typewriter after their separation and ultimate divorce.
State Register of Historic Places nomination for Alderbrook Farmhouse. Submitted by Bob Patton, son of early Doe Bay settlers.
Poem from Carroll Culver to Ken, typed on Smith Corona with blue ribbon. From summer 1956.
Text of Carroll Culver's obituary notice.
Carroll Culver's speech at the Shorewood Road opening (Part 1 of 2). Building of road to Fickel and Judson homes. Formal ribbon cutting.
Carroll Culver's speech at the Shorewood Road opening (Part 2 of 2). Helge and Carroll spent years ribbing each other.
TBD

notes: Documents and objects from Ken Culver collection. Many items need rephotographing.
